<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Turn Away Misfortune](/Feats.aspx?ID=3707) <actions string="Reaction" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Esoterica" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=427" />
<trait label="Fortune" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=76" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Occult" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=120" />
<trait label="Thaumaturge" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=432" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 43</row>

**Trigger**
You would attempt a roll affected by a [misfortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=110) effect.

</column>

---

You perform a superstition, such as casting salt over your shoulder to ward off bad luck. Turn Away Misfortune's [fortune](/Traits.aspx?ID=76) trait cancels out the misfortune effect, causing you to roll normally. As normal, you can apply only one fortune ability to a roll, so if you Turned Away Misfortune on an attack roll, you couldn't also use an ability like [Halfling Luck](/Feats.aspx?ID=54) to alter the roll further.
name: Turn Away Misfortune
